name: Seven Terraces

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Seven Terraces is very different from other hotels... and the entrance is off a small alley. However once you arrived its like stepping back in time, or arriving into a rich man's private residence. Stunning oriental courtyard and oriental rooms with a touch of modern amenities. Bathroom is interesting and the loft bedroom can be a bit warm as well. However this is such a unique experience and you can walk out and explore the town on foot.
reviews.title: Unique hotel in a superb location

reviews.text: We have visited Penang few times. This is the first time that we have stayed in seven Terraces hotel. The hotel is nicely decorated, with a strong oriental retro style. The rooms are absolutely stunning. Right in the middle of George Town, we can access to other cafes and restaurants easily. The services are good, the restaurant in the hotel serves high standard fusion Nonyang food. Everything is perfect
reviews.title: paradise

reviews.text: Our party of four stayed in several rooms at Seven Terraces, Georgetown last week, and were transported back to a more gracious, relaxed era. In some ways, time stood still the moment which strolled into the lobby which gave onto a narrow lane which the motorist or even pedestrian could be excused for overlooking.
reviews.title: A Distinctive Charm

reviews.text: The spacious lobby exuded understated elegance and taste, while its lofty, spacious dimensions were like a rush of fresh air in the lungs. The owner had spared no effort in decorating it with ancient masterpieces culled from Penang's architectural and decorative heritage. But everything was pared down to the quintessence of refinement. There were no signs of the exuberance colours so beloved of Peranakans, with their riot of pink, mauve, cobalt, celadon, yellow, crimson. What the visitor saw were old carved doors, screens, tables and chairs of aged wood, gilded motifs and marbled landscapes.
reviews.title: Incredible place to stay.

reviews.text: For a hotel with merely 16 bedrroms and suites, the public areas were generous to a fault. Yet, the owner was right to have resisted the temptation to carve out more rooms in favour of flowing space and generous proportions inundated by light and circulating air. No effort was spared in rendering every corner and perspective impeccable in proportion, line and elegance. The ultimate tribute I can pay the hotel is to say that I wished I lived in such a home.
reviews.title: Tasteful hotel in Penang

reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel with the most wonderful service, and you don't have to pay an arm and a leg for it. Here you are known by your name. When you call reception, you do not say your room no, you tell them your name. When we came back with our shopping, 4 people came to take it to our room. When you sit at the pool, a glass of water and cut oranges is automatically places next to you.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights. The first was in the duplex Stanley Suite. We found it a bit inconvenient and not so practical because the toilet was downstairs and the upstairs is wooden flooring which makes a lot of noise and shakes the bed when you walk, so you can disturb your friend. And no one really wants to walk down the steep stairs in the middle of the night to go to the toilet. So the next day we asked for the single storey Stanley Suite and it was given. We loved it.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels, anywhere!

reviews.text: The bathroom is huge...too big! Bed is very comfortable and I had the most wonderful sleep.The receptionist organised a trishaw that took us to the heritage areas. The trishaw guy has his own commentary which is not in the brochures. Absolutely loved it. So much that 2 days later we went for an even longer ride, and brought more friends!
reviews.title: An Architectural Jewel

reviews.text: Restaurant does not serve the best food, but the service was very good. Well, I am local so perhaps I am too fussy. For foreigners it should be ok. Waitress was very friendly and told us to order 3 sets for 4 people, and even that was too much! Because we had 3 sets, we could only order 3 desserts and couldn't decide which and she gave us the 4th for free. Thank you! Told you the service was good...
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have already recommended this place to many friends, and yes I will return!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: From the moment we stepped into this hotel we knew we had made the correct decision.
reviews.title: Service , food and antiques !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the doorman's welcome to the smiling waiter bringing us our welcome tea to the superb manager and his spot on advice , this little hotel won our hearts.
reviews.title: Authentic luxury in Georgetown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a Stewart lane suite on two levels , living room and bathroom downstairs and spotless spacious bedroom upstairs. The pillows and duvet were a dream and the thann shower gel was refreshing and smelt exotic , then there was the shower up in the ceiling cascading down . Glorious!
reviews.title: It grew on us.
It should be called "Seven Heavens"
reviews.text: A gentle swim in the little pool was a lovely way to end a tiring day walking around the town and the restaurant was gobsmacking ! Piano player was talented and we loved the tunes he offered.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: High level of service by the staff , unpretentious and always there when you needed them. Upon check in we queried about mosquitos in Asia and when we returned to our room after a walk , a mosquito net had been put up for us. Snoozing by the pool one day we awoke to a plate of sliced oranges and iced water , not ordered but very welcome. These little things make all the difference .
reviews.title: More Minuses Than Pluses

description: Seven terraces Hotel is a grand row of seven C19th Anglo Chinese terraces. The hotel is situated in one of Penang’s finest and most intact heritage streets which is in the very heart of the World Heritage Site and next door to the 1810 Goddess of Mercy Temple with just a few minutes walk from all the major icons. It successfully captures and celebrates the spirit of this world heritage town and its unique Peranakan culture.
